title: Earthquake map shows major sites of u.s. temblors
author: Ap
text: WASHINGTON -- More than 10,000 earthquakes took place in the United States in the decade after 1975, and people interested in the moving earth can study them on a new map from the government.         The U.S. Geological Survey prepared the map, showing locations of quakes measuring 2.5 or more on the Richter scale in the 48 contiguous states. In addition, major geological boundaries and faults are shown on the map, titled ``Seismicity Map of the Coterminous United States and Adjacent Areas, 1975-1984.''         The map, GP-984, costs $3.10, plus $1 per order for postage and handling, and can be purchased from the Map Distribution Section, U.S. Geological Survey, Federal Center, Box 25286, Denver, Colo. 80225.
